patterns_discovered: Documentation completion follows structured Phase 7 approach (doc-1, doc-2, doc-3, doc-4)
Inline comments focus on security considerations and design decisions
Git commits use consistent auto-claude naming convention
Auto-claude system tracks subtask completion across multiple configuration files
Memory system maintains session insights and attempt history
Build progress files maintain chronological and hierarchical organization
Documentation subtasks completed across sequential sessions
Inline comments explain 'why' rather than just 'what' of the code
Security considerations are consistently highlighted throughout the codebase
gotchas_discovered: Auto-claude status shows individual subtask counts that require manual tracking across sessions
Inline code comment subtask completed in session 32 while documentation subtasks were completed in sessions 29-31
Documentation requires updating multiple system files (implementation plan, build logs, status files)
Inline comments span across multiple source files with different concerns (security, performance, design)
System requires maintaining consistency between documentation and actual code implementations
Phase completion requires updating multiple tracking files simultaneously
Test files must remain passing while adding documentation
Multiple Git commits needed for proper version tracking of documentation work
